title:
Crossover from Anomalous to Normal Diffusion: Ising Model with
  Stochastic Resetting
abstract:
In this paper, we investigate the dynamics of the two-dimensional Ising model
with stochastic resetting, utilizing a constant resetting rate procedure with
zero-strength initial magnetization. Our results reveal the presence of a
characteristic rate $r_c \sim L^{-z}$, where $L$ represents the system size and
$z$ denotes the dynamical exponent. Below $r_c$, both the equilibrium and
dynamical properties remain unchanged. At the same time, for $r > r_c$, the
resetting process induces a transition in the probability distribution of the
magnetization from a double-peak distribution to a three-peak distribution,
ultimately culminating in a single-peak exponential decay. Besides, we also
find that at the critical points, as $r$ increases, the diffusion of the
magnetization changes from anomalous to normal, and the correlation time shifts
from being dependent on $L$ to being $r$-dependent only.
